result.execSummary:
The defendant George T Berka was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: EACH OTHER AS TO BOTH COUNTS; STRAIGHT TIME

miscConds.notes:
AS TO BOTH COUNTS: Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, and assessments by the end of probation period or any remaining balance shall convert to a civil judgment.
- Restitution set at zero.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
- Perform 25 hours of community service.
- Obtain/AODA assessment and cooperate with any follow-up care/treatment.
- Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George T Berka in court with Attorney Leah R. Thomas.  
Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNTS 1 AND 2:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Elements sheet, received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   

Statements made by State, defense, and defendant. 
 
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction on each count, STRAIGHT TIME, Consecutive to each other, with credit for 3 days. 

The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 MONTHS with the following conditions.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
*Perform 25 hours of community service;
*Obtain AODA assessment and cooperate with any follow-up care/treatment;
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens;
*Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees, and assessments by the end of probation period or any remaining balance shall convert to civil judgment.  

The Court ordered restitution set at zero.
Filed;
-Miscellaneous letters/documents (x10);
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant George T Berka in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON  (3/12/15). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Status conference scheduled for 06-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for George T Berka
Current: 1003 South 75 Street, West Allis, WI 53214   (Effective: 03-11-2015)
Prior: 1003 South 75 Street, West Allis, WI 53214

Defendant George T Berka in court with attorney Leah R. Thomas.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.
Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br.24  for a Status Conference.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 3/11/15 @ 1:30 pm
